definitions.definition: To see; to get sight of (something); to register visually.
examples: to sight land from a ship

subdefinitions.definition: To observe through, or as if through, a sight , to check the elevation, direction, levelness, or other characteristics of, especially when surveying or navigating.

definitions.definition: To apply sights to; to adjust the sights of.
examples: to sight a rifle or a cannon

definitions.definition: To observe or aim (at something) using a (gun) sight .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To see; to get sight of (something); to register visually.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To apply sights to; to adjust the sights of.
( transitive , intransitive ) To observe or aim (at something) using a (gun) sight .
